website_summaries.verdict: The TPS 520 GV Evo from Asolo is a backpacking boot that’s well-received through its offers of comfort and support. Likewise, it was able to protect the foot from water intrusions. Despite these praised features, its rating dropped drastically because of its questionable durability. It made users feel that it was not a good purchase at all. To conclude, if the brand is to refine the TPS 520 GV Evo, it may soon be highly regarded in the outdoor footwear industry.
pros: Hordes of hikers appreciated the ankle support from the TPS 520 GV Evo
It did not require an extended breaking in, based on a considerable number of users
A couple of outdoor enthusiasts lauded its waterproofness
The comfort of the Asolo TPS 520 GV Evo impressed many brand loyalists
cons: A high percentage of users were disappointed when the soles separated from the boot after a few years of minimal use
The TPS 520 GV Evo from Asolo was an ultra-expensive rip-off, according to numerous dismayed hikers
Several owners did not like its hefty weight

customer_reviews.title: Wear right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The first set lasted almost 16 years till I could no longer glue the soles back on. Comfortable enough to hike in right off. No break-in needed. They are heavy but that is excellent for the Maine woods sharp rocks and slippery roots. Great ankle protection. No worries with water or mud as your feet stay dry. I hope they continue to make these. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: sweet boots
customer_reviews.text: The boot are extremely comfortable and well made. Most of the negative reviews I have read deal with de-lamination of the sole after some time. This cant be avoided with any molded mid sole. In all, great price here and will recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Z-MAN

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever
customer_reviews.text: Amazing support and comfort. This is the second time my husband has purchased this exact boot and wears them everywhere. He works on his feet in all kinds of conditions and different floor surfaces and he thinks these are the BEST boots he has ever own! There are pricey up front but so worth the price. As he says you only have one set of feet and should take care them! Would recommend them over and over!
customer_reviews.author: Swin3

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: Thanks, this is the second pair of Asolo boots I have purchased. The first pair is still in service. I am so impressed with the performance of the boots I purchased another pair. Just in case they are no longer available. I'm unsure of the world's problems. If I have to head for the hills, well I just want to be prepared. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second set I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I really loved these boots, so I bought another pair after pair 1 fell apart (owned for ~12 years). I also bought a pair of Danner Grouse boots at the same time. I love the Danner boots and now wonder when I'll ever wear these again. The short version is that my feet feel beat up after a few hours chasing pheasant/quail/chukar in the Asolos, and they do not in the Danner pair.
customer_reviews.author: Salmon Fisherman

customer_reviews.title: Great boot & excellent fit
customer_reviews.text: I have hiked easily 50 miles with these boots. One reason for the purchase was the extra width offered - which I needed. Few boots offer this. I hiked 20 miles one cold winter day and my feet were toasty warm the entire day. A few things to note: they are a bit on the heavy side and have no traction on ice. It appears LLBean is selling this boot under it's own brand name. I'm looking for a lighter option for summer hiking.
customer_reviews.author: N. Andrix

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: High-quality hiking boots. Experienced no break in period with these. A bit costly but well worth the price. The interior lining creates a nice snug fit around your feet. Exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Great Leather Boot
customer_reviews.text: I also got the Columbia Daska Pass III Titanium Outdry Extremes and Scarpa Zodiac Plus GTX boots. All of them fit relatively well but ended up going with the Scarpa. For me, this boot was slightly large for the stated size. It's also relatively heavy (compared to the Scarpa). I previously owned a pair of these and they lasted 8-ish years and loved them but decided on a lighter boot this go around.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: i have flat feet and a fairly significant bunion on my right foot, these boots form to my feet really well. They are comfortable and most importantly offer a ton of support. I change out the insoles to meet my exact needs as i have metatarsal issues as well. This is my second pair of these boots and I just couldn't be happier. They keep me comfortably on my feet for 40+hours a week at work.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Juenemann

customer_reviews.title: This is a serious working/Hiking boot!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair spanning over 25 years! I wear them primarily for work. I have always felt the comfort and safety of having a very supportive boot on my feet for any kind of work! I wear them literally until the soul separates and the inner lining at the back of the ankle parts from the outer boot, which are my only two complaints as it seems consistent with many of your other reviewers. I don't like to spend $330 for a boot but considering the length of time they last, the comfort and the improvement in contact with whatever surface you walk on they are worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: These boots are incredible. It's my second pair. My dog chewed up my first ones after 10 years of wearing and they were still great. Dog, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Petree

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! I’ve been wearing this boot for years. I am a custom home builder with 44 years in the field. I wear them 6 days a week, year round and they get a lot of abuse. They last me around three or four years, which is really great considering the maltreatment they get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: out of box, 8 mile hard hike, perfect fit and comfort. second pair, first pair 4 years before re-sole needed, now in closet for spare. Love these boots
customer_reviews.author: john Goff

customer_reviews.title: Feels great on your feet.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best hiking boots I've ever worn. They fit like a glove and are very good looking footeear. No need to add inner sole supports like other boots require. I have 2 pairs, one is a half size bigger to accommodate thicker socks for the winter. Buy a pair they do not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer DJP

customer_reviews.title: great pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: Wore the first pair out after almost everyday use for 4 years, great pair of boots. Will keep water out when briefly submerged to the first few laces. Breathes OK, gets bit warm in the summber but the comfort more than makes up for it. Added an orthopedic sole for the aching feet for 72 mile Mt Whitney hike and worked beautifully! Could not be happier with this boots!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Best boot I've owned so far (and I've owned a lot) well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These boots are absolutely amazing. I have worn them every day sense I got them out of the box- about a weeks worth of break in time. Completely waterproof and a very nice hiker if you can handle a heavier boot.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Ranger Boots
customer_reviews.text: powerful boots- my second pair. last pair was bought in 2014. takes a minute to break them in. they last long, polish and hold a shine, keep warm in snow, i wear them daily for work. they last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Turd Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boots!
customer_reviews.text: This version of Asolo’s boot replaces my 30 year old pair. The new boot fits well right out of the box. The old pair fit like a wonderful extension of self.
customer_reviews.author: RSS

customer_reviews.title: Best In Quality
customer_reviews.text: I buy this same boot every two years; wear 'em every day.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: These are my go-to hikers.
customer_reviews.text: These boots were true to size, comfortable and totally waterproof. This is my third pair of this brand boot and they always last at least 4 to 5 years wearing them three and four times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've ever put on my feet
customer_reviews.text: These boots are the GOAT - will last (almost) forever. I beat these boots up for over 13 years before the soles literally fell off. Lots for hiking the AT, but I also wore them every day. Little heavy, but my feet never fatigued. Waited 1 year to buy my next pair because - about 12 months too long.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Sized a little small
customer_reviews.text: Good boots but they are sizes a little in the US. I where a 10M normally and I had to send them back and get a 10.5M. My toes were just barley hitting the end in the 10s, but seam like nice boots other than that.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: OMG! This is my third generation of this boot.
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly out of the box and the laces were exactly as I expected. I've owned two previous pairs of this boot, so I know what it should feel and look like out of the box, firm, exact, and strong. I will buy this boot as long as Asolo produces it, going on 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: David W Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these boots I wear an 11 and there is a little wiggle room however I think if I got a 10.5 it would be too snug
customer_reviews.author: Carl Sagan is my mentor

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy and waterproof boot!
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of boots my husband has ever had, so this was his third pair! Actually he slipped and his foot went under the lawn mower and the blade broke his big toe but the boot saved his foot. It cut the boot just a little bit and he glued it back together with gorilla glue and is still wearing them today! And they’re still waterproof!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Crager

customer_reviews.title: They're tough and comfortable..
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason special forces use these in the mountains of Afghanistan and elsewhere. They're tough and comfortable...well designed, well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of the same boot my husband has ordered. He likes the quality and the fit.
customer_reviews.author: janet c

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: I have a large wide high volume foot and the wide EE boat fits great. Once these get broken in they will be even better
customer_reviews.author: richard swendsen

customer_reviews.title: If you only can have one pair of footwear let it be this
customer_reviews.text: These are the best all around boots in the world
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Tree

customer_reviews.title: Best. Boot. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Dont get any other pair of boots. Period. Last pair were good for 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Favorite boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfortable right out of the box.These are the third or forth pair that I have own being a carpenter I wear boots every day so they need to be durable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dog guy

customer_reviews.title: No doubt the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the best you can buy so do it
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Self

customer_reviews.title: It's the third pair of Asolo TPS 520 I have ...
customer_reviews.text: It's the third pair of Asolo TPS 520 I have owned. I have put over a 1000 miles on each pair of boots. I have never had any problems with them. I can't wait to get 1000 miles on this pair of Asolo.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B Lowry

customer_reviews.title: The best boots!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair my husband has had, and he loves them. You couldn't get him to switch boots for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Fine pair of shoes
customer_reviews.text: They ended up being a perfect fit. I thought they were a little wide at first but now they’re perfect. I really like them so far. I kinda wish they had a toe guard because I scuff it up a little but other than that I like them
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and very supporting.
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second set of these boots. They usually last me about 7 years and are the best I have ever trusted to my hike and backpacking. Just take the time to clean and oil as per the manufactures guidelines.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Love this boot!  No break in
customer_reviews.text: I try different brands, but always return to this boot. No break in... feels great from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Arlen

customer_reviews.title: Best boot ever
customer_reviews.text: Best boot I’ve ever owned. Comfortable and great support. Highly recommend this boot. Hiked 26 miles straight out of the box in the beartooths with no sore feet or problems with comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Bakken

customer_reviews.title: The best support for my husband's feet
customer_reviews.text: These boots are so sturdy and offer such great support on rocky trails, but they are not too heavy. The pair these boots replaced lasted twenty years.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Foote

customer_reviews.title: Well made boot
customer_reviews.text: Very good boot and excellent support. I bought these for construction work to replace Keen boots.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd pair in 18 years. Best boots I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Part Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boots - had them for 20 years
customer_reviews.text: Amazing boots - had them for 20 years. Looking forward to another 20 years (I'll be 95 - well I can dream!)
customer_reviews.author: Edward L.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp looking boots!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 1 size larger based on the reviews here and they fit perfect. Love the look and feel.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: Qualityoutstanding
customer_reviews.text: Used these with the Boy Scouts, time to replace can not beat the price or quality
customer_reviews.author: JJT

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: These are the only boot my son will wear. He loves the fit and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boot! Designed to be rigid and strong to support heavy pack loads, but comfortable enough that they won’t rub your feet raw with blisters. This is a good boot for hiking and early-season hunting, but the rigid sole makes walking quietly more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots and quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: So Far I love these boots. I have not had much time to work on the breaking in but they feel good and look good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, durable boot
customer_reviews.text: Best boot I’ve ever owned. Newer versions to tend to separate at the toe
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boots
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair for over 10 years, but the soles were worn flat. Hoping these are made the same way.
customer_reviews.author: T.Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Damn good boots
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair I've gotten 1000+ trail miles out of each pair so far! Excellent boots!
customer_reviews.author: William M. Cole III

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Very durable and so far handling everything coming at them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend them to a friend
customer_reviews.text: They are great boots for hiking or just walking around
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best hiking boots available after 10 years, I just got my second pair...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: over 20 years, my 3rd pair..love em love em love em!!!
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Could not be happier with these boots. Would recommend them to anyone. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be....
customer_reviews.text: The soles on these started to fall off after 5 weeks of daily wear. No hiking, no mileage. One of the reasons I ordered these was Asolo's 2 year manufacturers guarantee. However, the guarantee needs to be serviced through the seller, Pike to Peak & they have refused. I don't know if they aren't an authorized vendor; or if they were knock offs. either way, I'll never make a pricey purchase through a third party seller. Previous pairs of Asolos held up well; these are garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Asolo Rocks
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these boots over the past 10 years. (I'm very hard on them) Any other boots would last me 6 months if I'm lucky. The only issue that I have had with them is eventually the sole wears out after a few years of daily use. Other than that I think they would last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: I've been hiking and backpacking for about 40 years and Asolo definitely makes the best boots I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Asolo boots. When they wear out I will be buying another pair. I've been hiking and backpacking for about 40 years and Asolo definitely makes the best boots I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Success Fisherman

customer_reviews.title: The boots are very well made with the stitching between ...
customer_reviews.text: The boots are very well made with the stitching between the upper and tongue of the boot preventing any water leaking into the boot. The D fitting is generous for anyone with a normal sized foot. So far, i am also finding that the sole is wearing well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Some may not like boots this stiff but walking on rough terrain at ...
customer_reviews.text: I went to REI and EMS to try on these boots. AMAZON had them for less than 2/3 the cost. Some may not like boots this stiff but walking on rough terrain at this price point I've not found better. The VIBRAM soles (IMHO) are the key. I experience far less fatigue due to the stiff nature of the boot. When stepping on stones and sharp rock edges, the pressure points are dissipated by the sole of the boot thereby causing far less fatigue. It provides excellent ankle support. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A. Horvath

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hard to break in but very good product after break
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Asolo Men's Leather Gv Evo Boot
product_meta.description: The Asolo TPS 520 GV Hiking Boot is for those who love long lasting, water-resistant leather uppers, and their durability. A top-of-the-line Vibram sole provides excellent traction on any type of terrain you encounter. A Gore Tex lining is included for total water-resistance.
